scene_metadata.title: Scientific Observation
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: truth versus utility in therapeutic communication

dialogue.text: I say it not to tell you something true about the world. I say it because I want to observe what you do with it.

psychological_notes: The architect reveals an even deeper layer - their statements aren't about truth but about eliciting responses for observation. This positions the architect as researcher and Evan as subject, though a willing and aware subject. The therapeutic relationship becomes explicit experiment in consciousness studying itself.
philosophical_underpinning: Truth is less important than transformation in therapeutic dialogue
therapeutic_direction: Therapy as mutual experiment in consciousness
